data.title: Govt must avoid conflict zones
data.description: The House Committee on Foreign Affairs has asked the Ministry of Labour to shift its labour export policy away from war-torn countries, such as Israel, to more peaceful ones.

data.title: Singapore keen on Thai workers
data.description: The Labour Ministry aims to export more Thai workers to Singapore, especially in the shipyard sector.

data.title: PTP pushing to  cut vote threshold
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party (PTP) is seeking to reduce the size of the majority required to pass a referendum on the constitution.

data.title: Hope afloat as busy Loy Kratong predicted
data.description: About 85% of hotel rooms in Chiang Mai have been reserved by tourists for the Loy Krathong festival, which is expected to generate up to 2 billion baht in income for the province.

data.title: City plan upsets consumer group
data.description: The Thailand Consumer Council (TCC) will submit a petition against the Bangkok city plan to the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Wednesday, citing flaws in public hearing processes that violate people

data.title: Soft power plans for city market
data.description: The National Committee on Soft Power Development has vowed to develop Chatuchak Weekend Market in Bangkok as Thailand

data.title: Thai navy chief visits Koh Kut amid row
data.description: Royal Thai Navy (RTN) chief Adm Jirapol Wongwit visited  Koh Kut  and assured Thais that the navy’s duty is to protect national interests and sovereign territory to the full.

data.title: Navy chief visits Koh Kut amid row
data.description: Royal Thai Navy (RTN) chief Adm Jirapol Wongwit visited  Koh Kut  and assured Thais that the navy’s duty is to protect national interests and the sovereign territory to the full.

data.title: High blood pressure tops Thai outpatients' medical woes
data.description: High blood pressure was the top medical condition among universal healthcare service outpatients in 2023, according to Thailand

data.title: High blood pressure tops medical woes
data.description: High blood pressure was the top medical condition among universal healthcare service outpatients in 2023, according to the National Health Security Office (NHSO).

data.title: Pyramid scheme charges added to multi-billion-baht iCon Group case
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation is listing the suspects who will additionally face fraudulent borrowing, aka  pyramid scheme , charges in  The iCon Group  direct marketing case.

data.title: Pyramid scheme charges on multi-billion-baht The iCon Group direct marketing case
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation is listing the suspects who will additionally face fraudulent borrowing, aka  pyramid scheme , charges in  The iCon Group  direct marketing case.

data.title: Most Thais think few honest volunteer lawyers exist: poll
data.description: Most Thai people think that “genuine volunteer lawyers” really exist but there are only a few of them, according to a survey by Nida Poll.

data.title: Thai govt sends letter of protest to Israel
data.description: The government has submitted a letter of protest to  Israel , requesting that no more Thai workers be sent to high-risk areas following a recent rocket attack that killed four Thai workers and injured one.

data.title: Bangkok's City Hall to enact new pet policy
data.description: The  Bangkok Metropolitan Administration  (BMA) will implement a new policy to regulate the number of domesticated  cats  and  dogs  in the city.

data.title: City Hall to enact new pet policy
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) will implement a new policy to regulate the number of domesticated  cats  and  dogs  in the city.

data.title: Activists plan to rally over Koh Kut island territory dispute
data.description: Activists are planning demonstrations in Bangkok and Trat next week, calling on the government to clarify its position on the  Koh Kut  island dispute between  Thailand  and  Cambodia .

data.title: Govt sends letter of protest to Israel
data.description: The government has submitted a letter of protest to  Israel , requesting that no more Thai workers be sent to high-risk areas following a recent rocket attack that killed four Thai workers and injured one.

data.title: FM pushes regional partnerships
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa said on Saturday that Thailand aims to work with South Asian countries on food, energy and human security to boost trade with the Southeast region.

data.title: Chiang Mai backs waste-to-energy plant
data.description: The Chiang Mai Authority has backed a Thai-Chinese  waste-to-energy power plant  that is expected to take two years to complete.

data.title: BMA to enact new pet policy
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) will implement a new policy to regulate the number of domesticated  cats  and  dogs  in the city.

data.title: Pheu Thai's legal eagles urge charter compromise
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has not ruled out the possibility of amending the  charter  in time for the next election as long as certain compromises can be agreed upon.

data.title: Drunk German biker smashes checkpoint, injures officer
data.description: PATTAYA - A German tourist has been arrested after crashing through a traffic police checkpoint on his big bike on Jomtien Road in Bang Lamung district, leaving the policeman seriously injured.

data.title: Orange Line construction disruptions expected
data.description: Construction of the western segment of the MRT  Orange Line  will cause some disruptions, the Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) has advised.

data.title: Alleged leader of Rohingya smuggling gang arrested
data.description: A Thai man accused of leading a  human trafficking  gang has been arrested along with two accomplices in connection with the smuggling of 26 Rohingya  migrants, three of whom died of suffocation in an overcrowded truck, police said on Saturday.

data.title: Purple Line flat rate fare to stay at B20
data.description: The Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) aims to extend the Purple Line

data.title: Scout uniform rules to relax
data.description: The Education Ministry will issue a regulation on scouting attire, allowing children to wear ordinary school attire instead of scout uniforms for scout events.

data.title: Phatthalung to push airport plan
data.description: Authorities and the local tourism sector plan to build an airport in Phatthalung to promote the province as a new logistics hub for the southern region.

data.title: 5m workers to be reskilled
data.description: The Department of Skill Development (DSD) plans to upskill and reskill more than five million Thai workers in 2025 with a special focus on digital technology to support industrial growth, says a senior labour official.

data.title: Zoo body slams monastery's use of hippo
data.description: The Zoological Park Organization has slammed a Buddhist monastery for using the image of "Moo Deng", the pygmy hippo and social media sensation, to produce Moo Deng trinkets used as sacred objects for wealth.

data.title: 10 'model' provinces to reckon with tackling drug problems
data.description: The government has announced 10 pilot provinces to test out ways of combatting issues related to narcotics.
